@metroid And btw, thanks for the recommendation! the character designs aren't that great, but the story is interesting. About that: 
Part 1 Isn't tagged as NTR, but I say it should- The female protagonist isn't happy about her husband fucking the other girl, however the husband barely do anything important besides adding the concept of "there's a husband". It is tagged swinging, actually .
Part 2 IS tagged as NTR, and that is correct. The female protagonist is feeling bad about being adulterous, so she wants to stops, BUT she changes her mind when she's shown how her husband happily keeps fucking the other girl (thus SHE is being ntr'ed- even the scene with her dying her hair is a representation of her leaving her husband emotionally) 
Part 3 Is not tagged ntr and it isn't, really. We know the husband exists, but he barely appears in one page at the end, and the phone messages show that he's aware about his wife's affairs and he just don't mind. This would be swinging.

@metroid You should put more attention on what you read, or try to understand stuff better. I pointed on that the important thing about NTR is the feeling on pain/despair/excitement (or all them at the same time) on the PROTAGONIST who is losing a dear person (either physically or emotionally) And yeah, I say PROTAGONIST because if the person who is being cheated/cuckolded isn't a protagonist in the story, then that story IS NOT NETORARE (by protagonist I don't mean the one the story focus on/is having sex, I mean that the "losing side"should be important/relevant for the story) I don't know why you mention the "sex=netorare" thing, I never said that. There is usually a tag for "swingers", so whats your point? Its a different kind of situation (the couple is open to and enjoys sex that way, as opposed to netorare)

Also you are wrong about your protagonist assumption , in most ntr stories the protagonist is the person who got ntred from their husband, bf, son, etc., not the other way around. Oh and one more thing, mr. moron, fucking someone doesn't equal to stealing that person, as in the case here. Otherwise all cheating stories would be automatically ntr. A good example of this there are swinging type of hentai which are not labeled as ntr, even though the guy sees his wife/gf fucked right next to him.

@metroid Sometimes the protagonist realizes the whole thing until the end, in which case ntr looks a lot like simple cheating, however in those cases, the whole situation ends without closure (the losing part is unable to stop the situation when he/she realizes it, and it seems that it will continue or its to late to rescue/take back his/her loved one) Hope this helps you to better understand the genre, my friend.
Btw, pro tip- insulting someone ISN'T a valid argument or makes your point valid/invalidates someone else's point. It just makes you look dumb.

@metroid Actually, it is, oh hentai youngster. Allow me to educate you: NTR is about a situation, not a whole genre. If you want to put it simple, is similar to "incest" or "cheating"- its a situational tag; there can be just one instance on a story, and it is enough for the whole thing to count. NTR happens when someone dear/loved/important is being taken/stolen/soiled while the first person KNOWS or realizes it, yet is unable or unwilling to stop the situation(this is the most important difference with simple "cheating"- Netorare might include cheating, but not all cheating is netorare). All in all, netorare will focus on the feelings of three points of view- the person who is being stolen (wife/girlfriend/boyfriend/mom-its the same, the point is that its a truly important for the other protagonist) the person who is stealing, and the important part is, the one who suffers by the whole ordeal (the reader relates to this one by proxy, and gets angry/sad/etc with him/her)
@LeCaster You obviously dont know what ntr is so you might as well stop talking bullshit like the shit talker you are. There is no such thing as "it's ntr for one scene" you moron.
